title: AB 1673
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 16520 of the Penal Code is amended to define a "firearm" as a device designed for use as a weapon that expels a projectile through a barrel by the force of an explosion or combustion. The definition includes the frame or receiver of the weapon in various sections of the code. In the Welfare and Institutions Code, "firearm" includes rocket launchers and similar devices with explosive material. Antique firearms are excluded in specific provisions. Destructive devices are not considered firearms in certain sections. In the Penal Code, the definition of a "firearm" includes devices designed to expel projectiles through a barrel by explosion or combustion. It also specifies that certain sections exclude destructive devices and that unfinished frames or receivers can be considered firearms in certain contexts. The Penal Code defines a "firearm" to include frames or receivers in various sections. It also includes rocket launchers and similar devices with explosive materials in specific provisions. The Penal Code defines a "firearm" in various sections, excluding unloaded antique firearms in specific provisions. It also clarifies that in certain sections, a firearm does not include destructive devices or unfinished frames or receivers that can be readily converted. The Penal Code defines a "firearm" as a device designed for weapon use that expels a projectile through a barrel by combustion. This definition includes the frame or receiver of the weapon in specific sections. The Penal Code includes specific sections that define what constitutes a firearm, including various provisions that expand the definition to include rocket launchers and exclude unloaded antique firearms. The Penal Code defines a firearm in various sections, including provisions on rocket launchers and unfinished frames or receivers that can be converted into functional firearms. The Penal Code defines a firearm as a device designed to expel a projectile through a barrel by combustion. It includes the frame or receiver of the weapon in several sections. The Penal Code defines a firearm as a device designed to expel a projectile through a barrel by combustion. It includes various sections specifying what constitutes a firearm, including rockets and similar devices with explosive materials, as well as exemptions for unloaded antique firearms. The Penal Code specifies different sections defining a firearm, including exemptions and what constitutes a firearm. It also clarifies the meaning of "firearm" in various sections, such as excluding destructive devices and including unfinished frames or receivers that can be converted into functional weapons. The bill defines "frame" and "receiver" as parts of a firearm that house the firing mechanism and can be converted into functional weapons. It also incorporates amendments to the Penal Code, contingent on the enactment of specific bills and timelines. Section 1.2 of the bill includes amendments to the Penal Code, dependent on the enactment of certain bills by January 1, 2017. Section 1.3 of the bill incorporates amendments to the Penal Code from multiple bills, contingent on their enactment by January 1, 2017. No reimbursement is required for local agencies or school districts due to the creation, elimination, or change in penalties for crimes under this act.
